column5: Percentage of patients aged 5 years and older with a diagnosis of asthma who were evaluated at least once during the measurement period for asthma control (comprising asthma impairment and asthma risk). National Quality Strategy Domain: Effective Clinical Care Process Measure
column7: Patients who were evaluated at least once during the measurement period for asthma control.

column2: AAAAI American Academy of Allergy, Asthma, and Immunology Quality Clinical Data Registry Powered by Premier, Inc.
column4: Allergen Immunotherapy Treatment: Allergen Specific Immunoglobulin E (IgE) Sensitivity Assessed and Documented Prior to Treatment
column5: Percentage of patients aged 5 years and older who were assessed for IgE sensitivity to allergens prior to initiating allergen immunotherapy AND results documented in the medical record.National Quality Strategy Domain: Patient Safety Process Measure
column7: Patients who were assessed and had documentation of IgE sensitivity to allergens in the allergen immunotherapy prescription prior to initiating allergen immunotherapy.
column8: Patients aged 5 years and older who initiated allergen immunotherapy during the reporting period.

column4: Adequate Off-loading of Diabetic Foot Ulcer at each treatment visit
column5: Percentage of visits in which diabetic foot ulcers among patients aged 18 years and older received adequate off-loading during a 12-month reporting period.
column7: All visits for DFU treatment in which adequate off-loading is documented within the 12-month reporting period.
column8: All visits for patients 18 years and older in which a diabetic foot ulcer (DFU) is documented as treated within the 12-month reporting period.
column9: Death, Palliative care patients, DFU patients receiving amputation, DFU patients seen for consultations only, DFU patients with <2 visits in 30 days
column10: Adequate off-loading not Prescribed for Medical, Patient or System Reasons
